javaslang

Interface Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T1 - argument 1 of the function
    T2 - argument 2 of the function
    T3 - argument 3 of the function
    T4 - argument 4 of the function
    R - return type of the function
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable, λ<R>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R>
extends λ<R>
    Represents a function with 4 arguments.
    Since:
    1.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Function4.Type<T1,T2,T3,T4,R>
      Represents the type of a Function which consists of 4 parameter 4 types and a return type.

    • Method Detail

      • lift

        static <T1,T2,T3,T4,R> Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R> lift(Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R> methodReference)
        Lifts a method reference or a lambda expression to a Function4.

        Examples (w.l.o.g. referring to Function1): 

        // lifting a lambda expression
 Function1<Integer, Integer> add1 = Function1.lift(i -> i + 1);

 // lifting a method reference (, e.g. Integer method(Integer i) { return i + 1; })
 Function1<Integer, Integer> add2 = Function1.lift(this::method);

 // lifting a lambda reference
 Function1<Integer, Integer> add3 = Function1.lift(add1::apply);

        Caution: Reflection loses type information of lifted lambda reference. 

        // type of lifted a lambda expression
 MethodType type1 = add1.getType(); // (Integer)Integer

 // type of lifted method reference
 MethodType type2 = add2.getType(); // (Integer)Integer

 // type of lifted lambda reference
 MethodType type2 = add3.getType(); // (Object)Object
        Type Parameters:
        R - return type
        T1 - 1st argument
        T2 - 2nd argument
        T3 - 3rd argument
        T4 - 4th argument
        Parameters:
        methodReference - (typically) a method reference, e.g. Type::method
        Returns:
        a Function4

      • isApplicableTo

        default boolean isApplicableTo(Object o1,
                               Object o2,
                               Object o3,
                               Object o4)
        Checks if this function is applicable to the given objects, i.e. each of the given objects is either null or the object type is assignable to the parameter type.

        Please note that it is not checked if this function is defined for the given objects.

        Parameters:
        o1 - object 1
        o2 - object 2
        o3 - object 3
        o4 - object 4
        Returns:
        true, if this function is applicable to the given objects, false otherwise.

        type2 - type 2
        type3 - type 3
        type4 - type 4
        Returns:
        true, if this function is applicable to objects of the given types, false otherwise.

      • memoized

        default Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R> memoized()
        Description copied from interface: λ
        Returns a memoizing version of this function, which computes the return value for given arguments only one time. On subsequent calls given the same arguments the memoized value is returned.

        Please note that memoizing functions do not permit `null` as single argument or return value.

        Specified by:
        memoized in interface λ<R>
        Returns:
        a memoizing function equivalent to this.

      • andThen

        default <V> Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,V> andThen(Function1<? super R,? extends V> after)
        Returns a composed function that first applies this Function4 to the given argument and then applies Function1 after to the result.
        Type Parameters:
        V - return type of after
        Parameters:
        after - the function applied after this
        Returns:
        a function composed of this and after
        Throws:
